pageContext.claim: “Well, they weren't like this. And also he was going from a much lower base I took over. If you look at him from the Great Depression forward, he had the worst improvement of anybody -- percentage wise -- of any president in modern day history. It was not much of a rally. And we have a major rally going on right now, in terms of jobs, in terms of... I think even in terms of world recognition, going beyond anything else.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump routinely tries to take credit for jobs created since the election, even though Obama was still president, yet here he calls economic growth in the first quarter of his presidency "Obama's last quarter." Moreover, Trump falsely claims "we were headed down" when in fact he inherited an economy that already had the longest period of unbroken job growth in U.S. history.
